communication_style.response_time_expectation: within 2 hours for Slack/email, immediate for stand‑up calls

work_habits.meeting_preferences: minimizes meetings; prefers short (15‑30 min) agenda‑driven sessions; open to video when needed
work_habits.work_environment: hybrid (3 days remote, 2 days in Austin office)

personality.decision_making_approach: data‑driven, prefers consensus after reviewing metrics
personality.collaboration_style: structured and reliable; likes clear roles and responsibilities
personality.stress_management_approach: uses Pomodoro technique, short walks, and mindfulness apps
personality.conflict_resolution_style: calm mediator – seeks facts, proposes compromise

availability.other_commitments: Weekly community DevOps meetup on Thursday evenings (1 hr)
availability.travel_flexibility: up to 20% of time; max 2 weeks per quarter for conferences or client sites

personal_factors.caregiving_responsibilities: Occasional elder care for a parent (≈1 day/month)
personal_factors.commute_situation: 20‑minute drive to the Austin office; occasional car‑share
personal_factors.health_considerations: Mild seasonal allergies; no chronic conditions
personal_factors.career_motivation: Aiming to become Senior DevOps Lead; passionate about building scalable, resilient platforms

collaboration.meeting_frequency_preference: Daily 15‑min stand‑up; bi‑weekly sprint planning; monthly cross‑team sync
collaboration.feedback_style: direct but constructive; prefers written follow‑up
collaboration.knowledge_sharing_habits: Maintains internal wiki pages, writes post‑mortem docs, hosts monthly brown‑bag sessions

potential_bottlenecks: Single point of knowledge on legacy Jenkins pipelines
Heavy reliance on one primary on‑call engineer during peak incidents
burnout_risk_factors: Insufficient documentation for newly acquired services
